text: The Ransomed Return to Zion
Wilderness and dry land shall be glad,\f + \fr 35:1 \ft The Hebrew has an extra “them,” probably from an accidental of the first letter of the next word \f*
and desert shall rejoice and blossom like the crocus.
It shall blossom abundantly,
and it shall rejoice indeed with rejoicing and exulting.
The glory of Lebanon shall be given to it,
the majesty of Carmel and Sharon.
⸤They are the ones who⸥\f + \fr 35:2 \ft Literally “they” \f* shall see the glory of Yahweh,
the majesty of our God.
Strengthen \add the\add* weak hands
and make \add the\add* staggering knees firm.
Say to those who are hasty of heart,
“Be strong; you must not fear!
Look! your God will come \add with\add* vengeance,
\add with\add* ⸤divine retribution⸥.\f + \fr 35:4 \ft Literally “the retribution of gods” \f*
He ⸤is the one who⸥\f + \fr 35:4 \ft Literally “he” \f* will come and save you.”
Then \add the\add* eyes of \add the\add* blind shall be opened,
and \add the\add* ears of \add the\add* deaf shall be opened.
Then \add the\add* lame shall leap like the deer,
and \add the\add* tongue of \add the\add* dumb shall sing for joy,
for waters shall break forth in the wilderness
and streams in the desert.
And the parched ground shall become \add a\add* pool,
and \add the\add* thirsty ground springs of water.
Her resting place \add is\add* in a settlement of jackals;
\add the\add* grass \add shall become\add* like reeds\f + \fr 35:7 \ft Hebrew “reed” \f* and rushes.\f + \fr 35:7 \ft Hebrew “rush” \f*
And a highway shall be there, and a way,
and it shall be called the way of holiness.
\add The\add* unclean shall not travel through it,
but\f + \fr 35:8 \ft Or “and” \f* it \add is\add* for them, he who walks \add on the\add* way;
and fools shall not wander about.
No lion shall be there,
and no ferocious wild beast shall go up it.
It shall not be found there,
but\f + \fr 35:9 \ft Or “and” \f* \add the\add* redeemed shall walk \add there\add*.
And the ransomed of Yahweh shall return,
and they shall come \add to\add* Zion with rejoicing.
And everlasting joy \add shall be\add* on their head;
joy and gladness shall overtake \add them\add*,
and sorrow and sighing shall flee.
